item.description:
1920, Witsand City, several young women mysteriously disappeared without leaving any trace. The police suspect a serial killer. You're going to investigate and find out it's much more than that. An incredible machination awaits you and many people are involved.

Your goal will be to unravel all this and put an end to this conspiracy forever!

For your investigations, you will have to choose from 6 very different characters. Depending on your choice, you will not experience exactly the same adventure.

The abilities of each character are: strength, charisma, intelligence, skill, and search.

In addition to these abilities, you will gain additional skills during the game. These skills will be very different for each character. They will be very important to the success of your missions and you will keep them from one investigation to the next. Your characters will also have health and mental health points. You will have to watch them very carefully, because if they fall to zero, your character will either be dead or completely crazy.

Ultimate Conspiracy is a true narrative game, you will not only have to thwart a conspiracy, but also complete many secondary quests that will help you in your investigation. You will also find many objects, but as in real life, you won't be able to carry as many as you want. Each object has a size score and this is limited according to the characters and their strengths.

You all play against the game together. You decide which character should do which action? Is it better to stay together or separate?

To solve each investigation, you will visit different places in the city, in the country and even in the world.

Playing Ultimate Conspiracy is very simple, you are free to visit the places you want in the order of your choice and as many times as you feel necessary.

You’ll have to solve many puzzles to progress in your investigation. Keep in mind to observe the items as a whole and if the solution seems complicated, do not hesitate to come back to it later.

In between time, money, investigations and puzzles, you’ll always be under pressure in Ultimate Conspiracy.

—description from the publisher

The village chief has disappeared. Panic ! The tribe needs a new head, but this time, as long as it's done it must be smart (it will change as the other would say) in order to evolve the whole human species (just that)! And this smart head is yours, of course! Except that others think so too, it feels like a fight in the Kroms.

The goal in Krom is to collect diverse and varied resources (bone, wood, stone, Krom, life ...) in order to be able to exchange them for Evolutions cards (which represents your smart head), but not any evolutions, we're talking here about inventing the Cine-Magnon or the Stupid-mouth. Each evolution card give you more or less victory point, depending on the level of "ingenuity" of the invention in order to end the game.

—description from the publisher

450 Cosas que hacer en tu vida

item.description:
450 Things to Do in Your Life is a voting game where players guess which activities their opponents would like to try and vote accordingly. It is a perfect game to get to know each other better and get the party started!

In 450 Things to Do in Your Life you will find 75 double-sided playing cards, each side contains three different activities. The lead player opens the card, and the player to the left side of him or her calls a random number of the activity. The lead player reads the task out loud.

After that, each of the players assesses their readiness to perform a particular task with a set of special voting cards that go from 0 - "I wouldn't do it - not in a million years" to 3 - "Wow, I'd love to try it!".

When all the players have voted they try to guess an approximate amount of points on the voting cards - a player who will be closer to the correct answer gets one winning point. So in order to win the game it is important to know and feel the other players: what they think of practical jokes, what will be considered funny, and what will be rejected as a stupid idea. The first player to reach 12 points wins the game.

During the game the players will not only have fun but also learn a lot about each other, and, perhaps, they even learn something new about themselves. Finally you can actually think about all the fun and crazy things to do in your life, like: "Am I ready to shave my head? Or scuba dive, or kiss a frog?"

Find out how well you know each other in this quirky party game!

item.description:
El cielo se ha nublado, se avecina tormenta. ¿Serás capaz de conseguir formar el arcoíris?
RAINBOW es un divertido juego para toda la familia donde deberás de forma ordenada conseguir formar tu arcoíris. Pero no será fácil, si bien el sol y la lluvia te ayudarán, las nubes, viento y tormentas te lo impedirán.
RAINBOW es un juego de 2 a 4 jugadores, a partir de 5 años de edad, con mecánica sencilla de conseguir cartas y evitar que tu rival lo consiga.
La mecánica de juego es muy fácil. Muestra una carta del mazo de arcoiris y otra del mazo de clima, y debes ir colocandola en tu zona de juego o "cielo", considerando que si ya tienes una carta similar estarás obligado a colocarla en otro cielo que no sea el tuyo. El primer jugador en conseguir los siete colores del arcoiris ganará.
El juego contiene un total de 4 arcoíris completos (28 cartas), y 50 cartas de clima que permite la interacción.

The sky is cloudy, storm is coming. Will you be able to make the rainbow?

RAINBOW is a fun game for the whole family where you must neatly arrange your rainbow. However, it will not be easy. The sun and the rain will help you while clouds, winds, and storms will prevent it.

RAINBOW is a game of 2 to 4 players, from 5 years of age, with simple mechanics to get cards and prevent your opponent from getting it.

The mechanics of the game are very easy. It shows a card from the rainbow deck and another from the climate deck, and you must place it in your game zone or "sky", considering that if you already have a similar card you will be forced to place it in another sky that is not yours. The first player to get the seven colors of the rainbow will win.

The game contains a total of 4 complete rainbows (28 cards), and 50 weather cards that allow interaction.

In a far away land, magical beings roam the Enchanted Paths — a fire-breathing dragon and a pure unicorn, a wise wizard and a brave knight, a cackling witch and a beautiful princess... Help the fairytale characters find their way to each other. Fold the game board to connect creatures and items. In order to win, you have to be the first to complete the task, so hurry up!

In the Enchanted Paths board game each player receives a special magical game board, which can be folded in 24 different ways. The goal of the game is to fold your game board correctly, and complete the task faster than the other players. The tasks differ in complexity. There are 90 challenge cards in the game: 30 easy challenges and 60 difficult challenges.

The challenge cards show the number of game characters that need to be seen (or connected by paths) on a game board. In order to complete an easy task, a player needs to fold the game board in such a way, that the required number of creatures or items can be seen on one side of the board. The difficult challenge requires the game characters to not only to be seen on one side of the game board, but also to be connected by paths. The first player to complete the task correctly receives a card, as a reward. The game ends as soon as one player collects 5 cards with competed tasks.

Play the game on both levels of difficulty with your friends or alone. Change the magical world of Enchanted Paths as you please, and help the fairytale characters meet. Set new records, and have lots of fun with this fantastic board game!

item.description:
Aqualiens is a fun boardgame for kids, in which players use special transparent cards to complete the tasks, and help the adorable creatures collect as many seashells as they can.

Meet the aqualiens - creatures that live on the bottom of a deep blue ocean. They really like seashells and, as everyone knows, you can never have too many seashells! They have learned to grow new arms and tentacles, so they can always grab just one more shell. Help them transform correctly, and collect as may sea treasures as they can carry.

In the Aqualiens board game each player receives one of the four cute aliens. Transparent cards and goal cards are placed in the center of the table, so everyone can reach them. Lay the transparent cards with arms and tentacles on top of your alien card to complete the task, but make sure to use as few cards as possible! The quickest player to grow and collect everything that's needed, according to the goal card, wins a victory crystal.

When the players are already good in playing with basic rules, they can try to make the game more complex, by adding some extra rules. In addition to arms and tentacles, the players have to collect a certain amount of seashells on the card of their alien. Note that if some player stops the round by saying "I'm ready!", and it turns out that the task is made incorrectly, then the player loses one victory crystal! The first player who receives 5 victory crystals wins the game.

item.description:
Run! Meteors are falling from the sky!! In Meteor Escape you play cards simultaneously to form your herd of dinosaurs. During each turn, based on the card you played you perform a different action such as shooting meteors and make cubs before the extinction.

Shoot the meteor ball in crazy ways determined by the last dinosaur card in play; you will physically launch the ball on the game box trying to extinguish the most dinosaurs of the main herd. But beware the increasing level of the oceans, how much risks are you willing to take?

The game ends after 6 turns, the player with the most points is the winner.

"Château Aventure" is a cooperative game in which you will experience extraordinary adventures in various worlds. It uses Jared A. Sorensen's Parsely system to mimic the play of a text-adventure computer game and features several of his original adventures.

One player will be the computer (or "parser") and will give to the other players details about characters, places, actions, and everything that may happen during the game.

The other players will play the same character successively, by each giving an instruction like "go West", "take key", "use key on chest", etc.

Each scenario has one or more victory conditions. If players managed to follow the right path and got a perfect score of 100 points, they win the game. A game can be lost if the main character is killed and players didn't save the game.

name.value: Hervé Tullet's ZaZaZoom!: A Game of Imagination

item.description:
One part matching game, one part dominoes, plus loads and loads of fun, this game is both a clever challenge to hone memory skills and a make-your-own visual adventure of colorful play pieces. With the tour-de-force inventiveness which fuels his already-classics Press Here, Mix It Up!, and Let's Play!, Hervé Tullet's open-ended game stimulates creative thinking and fosters imagination.

This open-ended game fosters creative thinking and imagination with lots of different ways to play. Here are a few to get you started.

MATCHING GAME: A clever memory challenge for 2 or more players
Spread the cards out color-side down in 4 rows of 11 cards each. The youngest player goes first and turns over 2 cards. If the pictures match, the player gets to keep the cards and take another turn. If the pictures don’t match, the player turns the cards back over, and it is the next player’s turn. Players take turns flipping the cards over and looking for matches. The game ends when all the cards have been matched. The player with the most matches wins. Note: For younger children, the game can be played with fewer cards; try 24 or 32 cards. For a more difficult game, spread the cards out not in rows but in a random pattern!

ROADBUILDER: Matching up lines for 2 to 4 players
Locate 1 of the black-and-white crossroads cards and place it in the center of the table. Each player picks 1 of the 4 sides of the card to build from. Place the remaining cards in the deck color-side down. Players take turns drawing a card from the deck and placing them on the table color-side up, matching up the lines to make as long a “road” as possible from their side. If a player reaches a dead end, he or she sits out the rest of the round. When no player can continue their “road,” all players collect the cards they’ve played and set them aside. Repeat, building new “roads” until all the cards are exhausted. The player with the most cards wins!

PATTERNGROWER: A collaborative visual adventure for 1 or more players.
This game should be played on the floor or another large surface, because the designs can get very big! Using both sides of the cards, players work together to make the largest possible design while still matching up all the lines. Try playing with all cards color-side up. Or try placing each fourth card black-side up.

See if you can come up with some variations of these games on your own!

-description from publisher

Form teams of two players each (max of 5 teams). Each team meets privately to come up with a non vocal signal to indicate when either teammate collects 4 of the same Crab Card.

Each player will get a hand of 4 cards.
One side plays at a time. On a side’s turn, all players on that side can simultaneously swap any card from their hand with a card from the middle of the table (The Ocean).

When you have 4 of the same Crab Card, you can't say anything out loud. Instead, when you’re ready, give your secret signal to your teammate. When they notice, they will point at you and shout, 'YOU’VE GOT CRABS!'

If they’re right, your team gets a point. If they’re wrong, your team loses a point.

However if a player on another team suspects you’re passing a signal, they can point and shout, 'YOU’VE GOT CRABS!'
If they are correct, they steal one of your points. If they are incorrect, steal a Crab Token from the accusing player.

The game is over when the last Crab Token has been taken from the Crab Pot. At that point, all teams should count up their combined Crab Tokens. The team with the most Crab Tokens wins.

item.description:
Say It! is the frantic party game in which crazy combinations lead to laugh-out-loud answers. Draw a pair of prompt cards, then compete to shout out the most entertaining response. What's "something sticky"... "that you find in the couch cushions?" Or "something shocking"... "you know too much about?" Don't delay it — just say it!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Cooperation is key in Cahoots! Play cards to one of four piles by matching color or number. Work together as a team to complete a series of goals — without communicating what's in your hand. Can you make all piles purple or green? Every card lower than four? All cards add up to ten? There's only one way to win before time runs out: Play in cahoots!

Note that the original Cahoots has a player count of 2-4, while Tippi Toppi (Schmidt Spiele's licensed version of the game) has a player count of 1-4. Notes a Schmidt editor: "It is works quite well as a solo game, too."

Not to be confused with the other Cahoots game released in 2018.
